name: unprogressive
content:
unprogressive adjective
(OLD-FASHIONED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Unprogressive ideas or systems do not encourage change in society or in the way that things are done: The society was a complex network of vested interests, was unprogressive, and was shot through with corruption.
More examplesFewer examplesThey put forward a view that a population with a decreasing number of young people would be unprogressive and less vigorous than other nations. Agricultural capitalism was wholly unprogressive, merely exploiting the poor without advancing production in any way. We discovered that our society was rotten, traditional, unprogressive.

unprogressive adjective
(TAX)
finance & economics
  specialized A unprogressive tax system is one in which the rate of tax is the same on small and large amounts of money: Unprogressive taxes tend to be things such as sales tax.
More examplesFewer examplesThese tax systems were complicated, inefficient, and unprogressive.They believe that income inequality is due to an unprogressive tax system.The problem with inflation is that it is like a very unprogressive tax, favouring the rich.
